definition: to follow the compass and go with the set square (idiom); to follow the rules inflexibly/to act according to convention
to follow/to adhere to/to abide by
to tread on/to trample/to stamp/to fulfill/Taiwan pr. [dao4]

sentences.english: These are times when virtue is vice and prudence is folly.
sentences.chinese: 在这个时候，循规蹈矩等于罪恶，谨言慎行就是愚蠢。

sentences.english: Comedy is the last refuge of the nonconformist mind.
sentences.chinese: 喜剧是不循规蹈矩者最后的避难所。

sentences.english: She is an obedient and well-behaved child.
sentences.chinese: 她是个顺从和循规蹈矩的孩子。

sentences.english: His spirits were always equable and he was an observant person .
sentences.chinese: 他的精神总是平稳的，并且他又是个循规蹈矩的人。

sentences.english: Or is it a privilege, carrying with it a responsibility for good behavior?
sentences.chinese: 还是它是一项特权，附带有循规蹈矩的责任？

sentences.english: Our laws should respect families following the rules -– instead of splitting them apart.
sentences.chinese: 我们的法律应当尊重循规蹈矩的家庭，而非拆散他们。

sentences.english: Being a serious person has its benefits.
sentences.chinese: 变成一个循规蹈矩的人有其好处。

sentences.english: You can think I'm a wimp if you want.
sentences.chinese: 您尽可以把我想象成一个循规蹈矩的人。

sentences.english: While China doesn't follow the rules, India has too many rules to follow.
sentences.chinese: 中国并不循规蹈矩，而印度却太因循守旧。

sentences.english: The key is knowing when to follow the rules and when to break them.
sentences.chinese: 关键是要知道何时该循规蹈矩，何时需破旧立新。

sentences.english: Last year one of the most popular preppie girls at school got pregnant.
sentences.chinese: 去年，学校一个大众族的循规蹈矩的女生怀了孕。

sentences.english: We're both hardworking people, and we've done everything by the book.
sentences.chinese: 我们都是辛勤工作的人，我们做每件事情都循规蹈矩。

sentences.english: To hold you job at this company, you must follow rules docilely.
sentences.chinese: 在这个公司里，你必须循规蹈矩才能保住饭碗。

definition: to follow the compass and go with the set square (idiom); to follow the rules inflexibly/to act according to convention
to be content with one's lot (idiom)/to know one's place
to rebel against orthodoxy/to depart from established practices
to follow the prescribed order; to keep to the working routine (idiom)
lit. one strong beat and one weak beats in a measure of music (two beats in the bar) (idiom); fig. follow a prescribed pattern to the letter/scrupulous attention to detail
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
